metadata.title: CVE-2020-6460 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in URL formatting in Google Chrome prior to81.0.4044.122 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofing via acrafted domain name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
